text: The 1899 San Ciriaco hurricane was the longest hurricane in the Atlantic on record and second longest recorded anywhere in the world. This storm packed winds of 150 mph. It caused serious destruction in the Caribbean and North Carolina. The storm took more than 3,400 lives. This hurricane happened in August 1899. Category:Hurricanes in the United States Category:Category 4 Atlantic hurricanes Category:History of Puerto Rico Category:19th century in Cuba Category:History of the Bahamas Category:1899 in the United States Category:1890s in Canada
title: 1899 San Ciriaco hurricane
